kernfrasen: setting out for a strange new world
when the road leads out into Godforsakenness
dominante_domeinen.conceptuele_metafoor: FAITH IS A JOURNEY INTO ALIEN TERRITORY

kernfrasen: Abraham is called 'the father of believers'
Jesus, the only Son of God
God had every right to do such a thing

metafoor_inventaris.metafoor_expressie: The strange world of the Bible / A foreign country

cognitieve_implicaties: The hearer expects to feel disoriented and needs a guide (the preacher/Holy Spirit).
theologische_implicaties: God is 'Wholly Other'; the Bible is not a self-help manual but a revelation of a different reality.
ethische_implicaties: The believer must be willing to abandon 'familiar' moral logic for divine command.
onbedoelde_consequenties: May suggest that the Bible is irrelevant to 'normal' life or inaccessible without experts.

metafoor_inventaris.vitaliteit_toelichting: The preacher revitalizes the 'journey' metaphor by using specific, gritty locations like Tibet and Saudi Arabia to emphasize the 'alien' nature of the text.

coherentie_analyse.coherentie_verklaring: The sermon maintains a consistent 'Traveler/Exile' schema. The transition from the physical journey of Abraham to the spiritual journey of the hearer is seamless.

succesvolle_blending.blending_strategie: The 'road' of Abraham leads to the 'cross' of Christ, where the traveler finds a substitute.

sterktes.beschrijving: Re-activates the 'Journey' metaphor by framing the Bible as a 'Tibetan' landscape rather than a familiar book.
sterktes.voorbeeld: We are asking questions in English, but the story is, so to speak, in Tibetan.

risicos.beschrijving: The comparison of a child's death to an airplane crash might overly secularize the 'fear of God'.
risicos.voorbeeld: A crash would mean the total wipeout of our family future.
risicos.potentiele_impact: Reduces the cosmic significance of Isaac to mere biological legacy.

text_world_analyse.primaire_wereld: The rugged, ancient Near Eastern desert (Mount Moriah).
sub_worlds: The 1970s academic world of Paul Lehmann

verstoorde_schemas.schema_naam: God as a predictable moral agent
verstoorde_schemas.verstoring_strategie: Emphasizing the 'incomprehensibility' and 'alien' logic of the command.
verstoorde_schemas.vervangend_schema: God as the 'Lord of the Promise' who operates beyond human reason.

schema_analyse.liturgische_schema_aansluiting: Fits the Lenten theme of wilderness and testing.

aanbevelingen.metafoor_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is dominated by the JOURNEY and SPACE domains. It successfully uses the 'Foreign Country' metaphor to bypass modern moral objections to the Akedah. The preacher avoids the 'Economic' domain (debt/payment) until the very end, focusing instead on 'Presence' and 'Trust'.

revitalisatie_suggesties.huidige_status: Briefly mentioned at the end; feels slightly disconnected from the 'Journey' theme.
revitalisatie_suggesties.suggestie: Connect the 'Substitute' to the 'Guide' role in the foreign country.
revitalisatie_suggesties.voorbeeld: The Guide who takes the blow of the avalanche so the traveler can live.

coherentie_verbeteringen.incoherentie: The shift from 'God as Monster' (potential) to 'God as Provider'.
coherentie_verbeteringen.resolutie_strategie: Use the 'Abyss' metaphor more consistently to bridge the two.

entailment_checks.metafoor: THE BIBLE IS A FOREIGN COUNTRY
entailment_checks.problematisch_entailment: If it is too foreign, the hearer may feel they can never 'live' there.
entailment_checks.aanbeveling: Emphasize that the 'Holy Spirit' is the translator who makes the foreign tongue intelligible.

alternatieve_domeinen.rationale: To describe the 'foundation' of faith when the 'future' is demolished.
alternatieve_domeinen.doel_concept: Faith in the face of loss.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterful use of CMT to handle a difficult text. The 'Tibetan' analogy is a brilliant cognitive hook.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_esthetiek: An aesthetic analysis would praise the Caravaggio reference; CMT shows how that reference functions as a 'Container' for the moment of divine intervention.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_kolb: Kolb would focus on the 'experience' of the Lehmann family; CMT focuses on how that story functions as a 'Schema' for the hearer's own faith.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_CMT: CMT reveals that the preacher is using 'Spatial Distance' (Foreign Country) to create 'Conceptual Distance' from modern ethical critiques.

appendices.notities: The sermon relies heavily on 'Verticality' (Mount Moriah, God from heaven) and 'Path' (Journey, road) schemas.
